alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 12:48PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Johnson County through 115 PM MDT... At 1248 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Powder River Pass, or 15 miles southwest of Buffalo, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Johnson County, including the following locations... South Fork Campground and Lost Cabin Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County
